summary:
## Electrons: Tiny Charged Particles

Electrons are tiny, negatively charged particles found in atoms. They are essential for many things, like electricity and chemical reactions. Think of them as the glue that holds atoms together.

Electrons can act like both particles and waves, which means they can move like tiny balls but also spread out like ripples in a pond. This makes them important in lots of technology, like batteries, electronics, and even solar panels.

Scientists discovered electrons in the late 1800s, and they've been studying them ever since.
title: Electron
